Haec ait1 et MaiaMaia, -ae, f.: Maia (the mother of Mercury) genitumgenitus, -us, m. = natus, -us demittitdemitto, -ere = mitto, -ere ab alto 
ut terrae utque novae pateantpateo, -ere: to be open KarthaginisKarthago, -inis, f.: Carthage arces 
hospitiohospitium, -i, n.: hospitality Teucris.
 1:The god Jupiter is the subject of ait.↩
